intro: Gerardia edwardsiana subsp. typica, commonly known as the Edwards' gerardia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Oregon. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
